document_data.name: ''Fairest Maiden''
document_data.mainbody:
'''''Fairest Maiden''''' was a rowdy tavern ditty overheard in the city of [[Samargol]], [[Samarach]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]]. {{quote|''Fairest maiden, hair like straw, fell for a young man she saw.
Fairer maiden, heart of clay, went and stole his heart away.
Maiden's brother, lad so brave, ventured forth her man to save.
Met the other maiden fair... then he hit her with a chair.
Thus an ending, nice and neatâ€”stories short aren't always sweet!''|A bard from [[Leira's Trick]]}}
document_data.History: By the {{YearlinkName|1374}}, ''Fairest Maiden'' was a popular song performed across the taverns in the jungle nation of Samarach, including the inn of [[Leira's Trick]] of Samargol.
